image.altText: Three police officers standing in the background, a police van in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Family violence prevention advocates call for the public to acknowledge the four women found dead in separate and unrelated domestic incidents across South Australia in the past week.

title.children: 'These lives matter': After four alleged domestic violence murders in a week, advocates don’t want the ‘crisis’ to drop off the radar

image.altText: A drone shot of The Perth CBD and surrounding areas with Mount Lawley and Highgate in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Data from CoreLogic shows Australian dwelling values have reached record highs.

title.children: Property values reach new heights as demand outstrips supply, vendors take homes off market

image.altText: A Black Friday sale sign in a shop window.

props.synopsis: Black Friday and Cyber Monday sales are expected to account for more than a quarter of all holiday purchases this year. But economists are predicting a "penny-pinching" Christmas as interest rates stay higher for longer.

title.children: 'Working harder for a whole lot less': Retailers are expecting record Black Friday sales, but a weaker Christmas

image.altText: A smart tv with various streaming app logos on display.

props.synopsis: The nation's biggest media companies are battling over how streaming services are presented to audiences, arguing some apps are being given an unfair advantage.

title.children: Is the government really trying to control your TV? Here's what its proposal on streaming apps means for you

image.altText: Seven men walk their bicycles in the snow, two border guards with high-vis vests escort them

props.synopsis: Russia says a humanitarian emergency is unfolding at one of its checkpoints on the Finnish border, where it says hundreds of migrants are stranded in freezing temperatures. Finland has accused Moscow of funnelling them there on purpose to destabilise the country.

title.children: Russia warns of 'crisis' at Arctic border with Finland

image.altText: Darrell Ray and the 1976 Moorabbin Cats.

props.synopsis: Darrell Ray, who sexually abused boys in government schools and at AFL club St Kilda in the 1960s and 70s, was awaiting criminal prosecution on another string of charges.

title.children: Notorious paedophile school teacher and football coach Darrell Ray dies with court date looming

image.altText: Burnt debris is scattered on a concrete surface.

props.synopsis: A vehicle exploded at a checkpoint on the American side of a US-Canada bridge in Niagara Falls, prompting the closing of four border crossings in the area, authorities said.

title.children: Two dead in vehicle explosion on bridge connecting New York and Canada

image.altText: rubble and debris from bombardment while people pick through the rubble

props.synopsis: A temporary ceasefire between Israeli forces and Hamas is set to start on Thursday morning at 10am local time, under a deal that would see Israeli hostages exchanged for Palestinian prisoners and humanitarian aid.

title.children: Temporary four-day ceasefire to start Thursday in Gaza

image.altText: A group of women in bikinis smile and laugh, holding up plastic champagne flutes.

props.synopsis: The Spanish city of Seville has long drawn partygoers from around the world — but some are clashing with the city's Catholic values.

title.children: 'Acts of obscene exhibitionism': Why this Spanish city banned bad behaviour from partygoers

image.altText: Michelle Bullock speaks at a podium with branding behind her. She is gesturing with her hand.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank's new boss has not backed away from tough talk, saying the bank must use its "blunt" tool of interest rates to hammer out inflation for the collective welfare of Australians.

title.children: 'Hairdressers, dentists and dining out': The price rises that told the RBA it needed to raise rates again

image.altText: Man stands near brick wall in black outfit. In front of him is woman in brown shirt and beige pants. They're near a door.

props.synopsis: Word games were all the rage in 2022, when Wordle grids were all over social media. An indie development duo from Melbourne are hoping to bottle some of that magic with their new word game.

title.children: How a Melbourne couple built a mobile game to take on Wordle

image.altText: A close up image of a man wearing a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Climate targets were legislated in one of the first acts of the newly elected Albanese government. It was a moment hailed as symbolising the sea-change election result, and now we know Australia is not on track to meet them, writes David Speers.

title.children: The government has a new plan to reach its climate change targets — we just don't know how much it will cost

image.altText: Origin energy img

props.synopsis: Australian shares are expected to open slightly lower despite gains in New York. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Sharemarket set to open lower, Origin takeover hangs in the balance

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Origin boss in last-minute bid push to save $20b deal

image.altText: A woman in a striped top smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: A major manhunt is underway for a man who allegedly murdered his wife, fled the scene and is considered armed and dangerous, South Australian police say.

title.children: 'Enormous' manhunt underway after woman found shot dead at Adelaide home

image.altText: A car parked outside a home, with police tape in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A man has been charged over the alleged murder of a woman in suburban Adelaide — one of four female victims who have died in suspicious circumstances in domestic settings in the past week.

title.children: Another murder charge laid after four women killed in SA in past week

image.altText: A man in the driver's seat of a car.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating reports Uber driver Harjit Singh was assaulted by passengers in Canberra on November 11.

title.children: Uber blocks Canberra driver from a week's work after man reports 'horrible' early morning attack

image.altText: Chris 'Willow' Wilson, holding an egg, loved spending time looking for adventures in the NT

props.synopsis: Chris "Willow" Wilson died while collecting crocodile eggs in remote NT early last year. Three people have since been charged in relation to an investigation into the incident, including Netflix star Matt Wright.

title.children: Here's what we know about the chopper crash that killed Netflix's Chris 'Willow' Wilson

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: Matt Dillon sits on couch with his walking cane beside him looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: What began as pins and needles in his feet quickly left 43-year-old Mackay man Matthew Dillon entirely dependent on his partner and unable to work.

title.children: Mysterious COVID complication leaving some sufferers unable to walk

image.altText: A red plume over townhouses on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: A perfect storm of scorching hot and windy conditions are making it difficult for firefighters to control a massive blaze threatening lives and homes north-east of Perth, as the city enters a third day of an "unprecedented" spring heatwave.

title.children: Fire crews facing 'dangerous' conditions as residents flee blazes amid unseasonal spring heatwave

image.altText: the bodies of dead rats washed up on a foreshore

props.synopsis: Videos show thousands of rats overtaking communities across outback Queensland as residents battle a plague of epic proportions. There are concerns the worst is yet to come.

title.children: 'Alive with the bodies of rats': Rodents rule the land and sea as plague spreads

image.altText: Clare O'Neil looks towards Anthony Albanese at a joint press conference in the Prime Minister's courtyard at Parliament House.

props.synopsis: It took just 14 words from Home Affairs Minister Clare O'Neil for ears to prick up. Innocuous to many, they were shocking to those in the know and again left Labor having to correct the record, writes Brett Worthington.

title.children: The 14 words that caused Clare O'Neil a whole lot of pain

image.altText: Fiona sits in her wheelchair looking directly down the camera

props.synopsis: Victorians who have dealt with police when experiencing mental health crises have shared their experiences in a new report, and are calling for the state government to deliver on its promise to change the system.

title.children: When Fiona faced a severe mental health crisis, police knocking at her door left her 'petrified'

image.altText: Maldives Working from Anywhere

props.synopsis: With more than 1,000 islands, Maldives is renowned for its white beaches, sun-drenched atolls and high-end resorts, but it's also emerging at the centre of a strategic battle between regional superpowers, India and China, after the election of a pro-Beijing president.

title.children: The tiny nation of Maldives asks Indian troops to leave after inauguration of pro-China president

image.altText: High Court of Australia

props.synopsis: Laws allowing authorities to use ankle bracelets and curfews to monitor 93 people released from immigration detention are now subject to a High Court challenge.

title.children: Emergency powers regarding people released from immigration facing High Court challenge

image.altText: A concrete structure in the middle of a river with a low amount of water in it

props.synopsis: A "generational" piece of water infrastructure for Queensland has been completed after years of construction plagued by cost blowouts, inundations and COVID-19 disruptions.

title.children: Australia's biggest weir built since World War II opens after delays

image.altText: The back of Kim Jong Un in front of a rocket launch.

props.synopsis: South Korea has suspended part of a 2018 military agreement with North Korea after it defied warnings from the United States and launched a spy satellite.

title.children: South Korea ends part of military agreement after North Korea launches spy satellite

image.altText: A man in a hoodie vapes

props.synopsis: Anecdotal evidence and posts on social media suggest using vapes to consume illegal drugs is becoming more popular.

title.children: The growing trend of drug use through vaping

image.altText: A woman wearing a bright yellow face mask look down at a nurse putting a sticker bandaid on her arm after a vaccination.

props.synopsis: Three years after being shelved, a human trial of a Queensland COVID-19 vaccine has shown it is safe and effective — but it's unlikely to be used to tackle the coronavirus any time soon.

title.children: This COVID vaccine research has scientists 'very excited' — but not about treating and preventing COVID

image.altText: A hooded man holds a laptop computer as cyber code is projected on him in this illustration picture

props.synopsis: Australian officials are increasingly worried about the Pacific's vulnerability to cyber attacks, with the government spending $26 million to set up "rapid assistance" teams made up of experts from the private sector and specialists from intelligence agencies like the Australian Signals Directorate.

title.children: Australia to deploy roving teams of cyber experts across Pacific as online threats grow

image.altText: A boy smiling holding a medal.

props.synopsis: Sam Le Feuvre got involved in sport to connect with people like him. In just 12 months, the schoolboy became an Australian record holder before going on to compete for his country.

title.children: From the bush to the international stage, Sam is breaking records and paving the way

image.altText: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu chairs the weekly cabinet meeting.

props.synopsis: If all goes to plan, guns in and around Gaza are set to fall silent as Israeli hostages and Palestinian prisoners are released and aid is delivered. Even in the darkness of this war, four parties can make an agreement, writes John Lyons.

title.children: Even in the darkness of this war, four parties can make an agreement

image.altText: A poster with the words HOSTAGE DEAL CEASEFIRE is held in the air by an obscured hand

props.synopsis: Israel and Hamas have agreed to a four-day ceasefire in their war in exchange for the release of 50 women and children held in Gaza. Here's what we know about the deal and what may unfold next.

title.children: Israel and Hamas have reached a temporary ceasefire deal after six weeks of fighting. This is what we know about it

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann arrives at court, with reporters behind him.

props.synopsis: Ex-Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann testifies in court about the events leading up to the alleged rape of his former colleague Brittany Higgins at Parliament House.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann takes the stand in defamation action against Network Ten, Lisa Wilkinson

image.altText: An elderly woman in a church

props.synopsis: The emails released to state parliament reveal members of Mrs Nowland's family knew the details of how she was injured "very quickly", with the NSW opposition saying it raises doubts over why the word "taser" was omitted from a press release.

title.children: Emails show timeline of police contact with Clare Nowland's family after alleged tasering

image.altText: A man sitting indoors in a suit jacket speaks and gestures with his hands

props.synopsis: Sam Altman says he is returning to OpenAI after being fired by the company and joining Microsoft only days ago.

title.children: Sam Altman to return as OpenAI CEO days after being fired and joining Microsoft
